cellularAutomata.graphics
Class CAFrame

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.graphics.CAFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
public class CAFrame
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

The cellular automata graphics. Creates a JFrame with a control panel that updates CA properties. Also incorporates a CA panel where all of the CA graphics are drawn.

Author:
David Bahr

TABBED_PANE_WIDTH_DEFAULT

public static final int TABBED_PANE_WIDTH_DEFAULT
The default width of the tabbed panes. May be smaller if the screen resolution is smaller than approximately 900.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

tabbedPaneDimension

public static java.awt.Dimension tabbedPaneDimension
The dimension of the tabbed pane (control panels). This value is set when the frame is instantiated and sized (packed).

setViewDisabled

public void setViewDisabled(boolean disabled)
Makes the frame appear half visible and half opaque to imply that it is disabled. This does not actually disable the components and only makes them appear that way.

Parameters:
disabled - When true, makes the frame appear disabled. When false makes the frame appear enabled.

setVisible

public void setVisible(boolean visible)
Make the frame visible or invisible.

Parameters:
visible - Makes graphics visible if true, invisible if false.

update

public void update()
Update all of the graphics panels and the frame.

update

public void update(boolean atEndOfSimulation)
Update all of the graphics panels and the frame.

Parameters:
atEndOfSimulation - True if this is the update when the simulation is stopped. This method may choose to update the graphics differently in that case.
